intro: Pycnostachys chevalieri, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces bright yellow or white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
